alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Chesterfield; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:23AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Powhatan, Amelia and Chesterfield Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Mattoax...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Mattoax. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural and some secondary roads flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to a crest of 23.7 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.8 feet on 01/05/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
